reviews.text: Great burger normal service youâ€™d expect at a pub and nice atmosphere
Been coming here for about 50 years. Always great.

I am shocked and dismayed at some of these glowing 5 star reviews. The theory of alternate universes can be proven by a trip to JG Melon alone. My experience could not be more diametrically opposed than these reviewers. Save for the staff, who were pretty good, this place is living on reputation. I'm guessing, tbh, since I haven't been there before last night. The only other thing it has going for it, is the fact that it's open late. Unfortunately, NYC isn't the city that never sleeps that it used to be. The story is this, we order two bacon cheeseburgers with fries, different temps on the burgers FYI. I kid you not, we got our food in under 3 minutes. I've never received food that quickly at a fast food restaurant. There's only one way that this is even remotely possible. And, it's not good. Both burgers arrived overcooked. The fries were just okay. We were in and out of there in less than 20 minutes. I don't mean that to sound like a positive. It isn't. I guess one is going to have to try it for themselves and hope they land in the universe that those 5 star reviewers reside in. All the best.

What's surprising to me is that people still wait in line for 1 hour to get a table and get a, at best, mid burger. Our experience started off strong when we realized, after a 45 minutes wait, that our name was not on the list, probably mispronounced at some point so nobody notice. The guy promised to fit us in but after 15 more minutes that only happened when we insisted again. After this, it was a hard comeback, but we were willing to look passed the wait. The hamburger is nothing special, and the size makes it overpriced. The place is cash only, what adds and extra layer of inconvenience to the whole experience. The cherry on top was a 15 minutes wait for the check. There was not bad faith at any moment, just a service and food that is not up to the expectations.
Burgers are good but they must had made the portions smaller last time I was here.
It's so popular so it feels homey but it's hard to understand the appeal

The burgers were good, but the service really needs improvement. After waiting nearly an hour for a table, we were only told after sitting down that the restaurant accepts cash only. We had just enough to cover the bill and leave a small tip, but unfortunately not enough time to go to the bank.

As we were leaving, our server confronted us and demanded a larger tip, which felt very unprofessional and disrespectful. We understand servers rely on tips, but they should be voluntary, not mandatory. It left a bad impression despite the good food.

Honestly - super overrated place - we asked for medium cooked burgers which were super overcooked. Tiny burgers we had to order another one - this one they cooked rare. Not worth the waiting of 50 minutes for a table. The waitress was nice.
Una hamburguesa excelente, totalmente recomendado!!
Great burgers at a good price.

The burger was good, especially the meat.
They accept only cash.
Great burger. Their Bullshot drink was perfect.

Really good burger & relaxed dive atmosphere.

Only reason Iâ€™m giving 4 stars is we had to wait 2+ hrs for a table when we were told wait was 1 hr. We arrived 7pm on a Saturday (likely their peak).

They seem to move tables quickly but it felt like most tables are geared to parties or 4. My observation was that they seemed to be seating large parties A LOT faster than parties of 2. Maybe come with 4ish people, plan to go to a bar for a drink if waiting an hour, and/or come late (after 9pm).

Otherwise great burger and fries!  Not sure Iâ€™d wait 2 hours again for it tho!
Rude service with mistakes on the bill. Server had massive attitude. Worst of all burger was lousy. Would not recommend. (Barely) Saving grace is a nice atmosphere inside.
Food is okay not special
One of my favorite burgers and vibes are immaculate
Diane Keaton used to go there...good vibrations
Best burger in NYC and comes quicker than most fast food joints.

The host made it seem like our table was ready, but we ended up waiting over 20 minutes with zero explanation. Then he â€œaccidentallyâ€ gave our table to the group behind us, also a party of four. Instead of fixing it quickly, we waited another 25 minutes with no real effort to make it right.

By the time we were finally seated, we were ready to walk out. I only stayed out of respect for JG Melon.
Mid food - very bad servicr

Kinda cold breezy day with plenty of space inside - kid at the door says the stroller canâ€™t fit inside but I can sit anywhere outside. I sit at a table outside then the staff say I canâ€™t sit there because itâ€™s too close to the door.

All you want on a breezy day with a baby is a welcoming atmosphere and this was not that.

Food and service on the whole was fine but the place feels stuck in the past.

Cheese burgers! very tasty. Many tourists are here during weekends, and sometimes they will be chocked 'cash only'. Cannot complain if you just want juicy cheeseburger that doesn't smell! Hosts are nice.

Best burger in Manhattan! No matter the time of day, that burger hits the spot! Go to what works, and as long as this place has been around, they clearly know what works! Great location! Great atmosphere! Great late-night hours! I recommend to anyone in the city!

0/5 STARS.
Had the most bizarre dining experience here.
Waiter was EXTREMELY rude.

We ordered 2 burgers which were great and asked for a third as we were very hungry.
We asked for this to be cooked medium.
After receiving it we cut it in half and it was completely raw with raw meet oozing out.
*photo attached for proof*
I asked a waiter who walked by to please exchange it for a medium cooked burger.
He said he would grab our waiter.
10 minutes went by and he didnâ€™t come back so I asked the same waiter again who walked by and he went to grab our waiter who I saw yelled at him saying â€œwhat do you wantâ€accompanied with aggressive hand gestures.
Our original waiter who just displayed this behaviour to his coworker in front of the whole restaurant then came to our table and said very rudely â€œ whatâ€™s the issue â€.
I explained very nicely and he said â€œ okay, give me the burger â€œ.
I looked at my friend very confused as he was standing over our table and could have picked it up himself.
Before I could respond he said in a very condescending and rude manner â€œ pick up the burger, put it on the plate and give it to me â€œ.
I proceeded to pick up the burger half put it on one plate and passed it to him in which he snatched it out of my hand and walked off.

It was very uncomfortable receiving such aggressive behaviour, particularly from a male. Due to this strange interaction we both decided we did not want the third burger as we felt like the establishment did not deserve any more of our money if this is how they treat their customers.
He did not walk by us again until he had the burger in which I said we would not like it anymore and can we please have the bill.
He sighed and walked off angrily, clearly knowing and realising we were not happy with his service.
He came back with the bill which was $50 and we had $60 cash.
I handed him the money and said can we please have $10 change.
He said â€œ what youâ€™re not gonna tip?â€
I said $10 change please as I believe you give the customer there money back first then they leave a tip as they please.
He said â€œ what I donâ€™t get 25%?â€.
I said $10 change please.
He came back and slammed the change on the table and walked off.

The behaviour prior to the tipping situation was already so hostile but to assume and demand a tip on the spot is so strange and he was so incredibly rude whilst saying these things to us.
I do not understand how this man is working at this restaurant.
I see previous bad reviews on here having a similar situation and I bet you itâ€™s the same person.

I have never left a bad review for a restaurant in my life but I have never experienced such awful behaviour from a waiter so I feel as though people should be warned before having your day ruined.

Totally not okay and I will never be coming back here again after coming here for years.

Most disappointing Burger experience in a while... people rave about the place but $15$ for overcooked burger and 7$ for puffed chips (they can't be called fries) are some kind of a joke? Cash only (totally fine with me), but zero vibe or attention from bartender/server, nobody asked how's the food or about another drink. Totally flat experience.

I came for martinis and burgueses with my friends, the burger was over cooked and I ordered medium, when they changed it, they brought another overcooked.
They were run out of martini cups and served the martinis in normal cups. Very bad presentation.

Very packed as always but the service and food has decreased.
Shame
Howâ€™s the alcoholic bartender? Worst service ever. Stay away
Best restaurant of our trip
Legend status and burgers as good as ever. Cash only.
one of the best burgers in the city - maybe the best - order it rare - its phenomenal
Accettano solo contanti.... A New York!!!!!
Best burguer (and apple pie) in NYC

Been wanting to try the burger at JG Melon for a long time. It was smaller than I realized, with a very thick patty, not greasy, and delicious. Fries were great too!

Great burger in your typical bar setting. Did not have to wait more than 10 mins on a summer Friday for a table during lunch. Donâ€™t forget cash!
Staple nyc burger. Been coming here for 15+ years, always hits the spot.

Very underwhelming. This is supposed to be one of the best burgers in the city? A terrible dry bun and meat not really anything special. Any random bar does it better. Such a shame because the venue is so charming. They have such a great place but don't care about the food or taking care of guests.
Good Big Burgers, and Sierra Nevada on tap.  Tight space.  It's ike Molly Shebangs downtown.
Always good

Had an extremely disappointing experience today at JG Melon.
After waiting more than 40 minutes without receiving my order, I politely asked the server to follow up. Meanwhile, every table seated after me was served. When I stood up to inquire again, I was met with an aggressive server who raised his voice and told me to â€œsit and have patience.â€

I then asked to speak with the manager, who showed no interest in resolving the situation. In the end, I paid for my single glass of wine and leftâ€”never receiving my meal after nearly 50 minutes.

This is hospitality at its worst. Guests should feel welcome and respected, not ignored and berated. There are plenty of places in New York to get a burger, and sadly JG Melon has lost a loyal customer who has been coming for years

Insta: @burgerlayover

Open since 1972, J.G. Melon is an Upper East Side institution famous for its juicy hamburgers, cottage fries, and legendary bloody marys. A true â€œsaloon with food,â€ it has been drawing locals and international crowds alike, from stars and politicians to artists, writers, and generations of families.

I went for the cheeseburger cooked medium rare with bacon. It arrives deconstructed: the beef patty on one bun, the bacon on the other, with onions and pickles on the side. The patty was nicely cooked, juicy, and full of deep beef flavor. But the real standout? The bacon. Extra crispy, slightly salty, and adding the perfect crunch to every bite.

J.G. Melon is a local favorite and a must-visit for burger lovers. No sauces, no gimmicks, just an old-school burger done right. And a quick tip: theyâ€™re cash only, so come prepared.

The vibe was good, place was quite popular. However, food was not worth it. The burger was expensive, small, and the patty and bacon was burnt (even though we asked for medium-rare).
If you want a good burger, there are plenty other great burger joints in NYC.

Not Worth It

This old and â€œfamousâ€ place is cash only â€” and honestly, thatâ€™s the best thing I can say about it.

The quality is bad, the food looks worse than what youâ€™d get at a casual backyard BBQ with friends, and afterward youâ€™re left with stomach pain instead of good memories.

The only positive: our waiter was really nice.

Went and waited 35 minutes to be seated only to sit down and wait another 35 minutes to get well done burgers despite ordering them medium rare. Sent them back and waited another 20 minutes and the burgers came out even more well done thanâ€¦
Really good burger but VERY overpriced
Good burger and fries. Be ready to order and have cash.
Classic and delicious! If you don't arrive before they open, prepare to wait in line. It's worth it, though!
Old school burger spot that never disappoints

Lugar sobrevalorado. Las hamburguesas nada del otro mundo, de hecho la peor que he comido en 10 dÃ­as en Nueva York. El sandwich es un simple pollo a la plancha.
Solo aceptan efectivo.
No merece la pena ir hasta allÃ­, si estÃ¡s de paso ok, pero ir a esprexamente no.

Food was amazing and service from bartenders... had a waiter rudely interrupt me when asking a question about cooking temp for next time in order to place his table order with bartender. Older but new server named Aaron, when I brought it up he tried brushing me off continuing the rudeness. If you get sat at one of his tables, either ask to be reseated or sit at bar.
literally incredible. burgers were insane and didnâ€™t make me feel heavy at all. $120 for 3 wines 3 burgers and fries. super well priced. loved sitting outside and only waited around 30 mins at 6:30
Cramped and inconvenient (who only takes cash in the year 2025?) but the food was, I must admit, very tasty.

Cheeseburger with tomato, lettuce and Cottage fried potatoes
ë§›ì€ ìˆìœ¼ë‚˜ ì„œë¹„ìŠ¤ê°€ ë³„ë¡œì—ìš”. ë¬¼ ë‹¬ë¼ê³  10ë²ˆë§í•´ì•¼ ì¤ë‹ˆë‹¤.

We decided to swing by this late-night spot since theyâ€™re open until 2 AM, and let me tell you, it was a great choice! Even though it was a Wednesday around 11 PM, the place was buzzing with people, which definitely made us curious about the food.

The restaurant is cozy, but the lively atmosphere really adds to the charm. Despite the late hour, the service was impressively quick, which we appreciated. Now, letâ€™s talk about the food! I ordered the bacon cheeseburger, and wow, it was delicious. They definitely donâ€™t skimp on the bacon, which was a delightful surprise! The burger had that classic, old-school vibeâ€”simple and grilled to perfection, just like I remember.

On the flip side, the fries didnâ€™t quite hit the mark for me. They were cut into chips and a bit too oily for my taste, so I think Iâ€™ll skip those next time.

All in all, it was a fun night out with great vibes and a fantastic burger. We left with zero complaints and a happy stomach!

Today I finally visited J.G. Melon, one of New York Cityâ€™s most famous institutions when it comes to burgers, and I can confidently say the legend holds true.
I kept it simple with a classic cheeseburger to really see if it lived up to the hype and it absolutely did. The bun was well-buttered and perfectly toasted, the patty cooked to perfection and exactly to my medium rare request. The burger comes plated with pickles and red onions, letting you assemble it to your taste. Just the essentials done right.
From the first bite, it was pure love! Juicy, flavorful, and unforgettable taste. Itâ€™s about a four-inch bun it packs an immense punch of flavor that stays with you hours later.
The atmosphere adds to the charm: cozy, pub-like, bustling with happy energy and dynamic. I went around 4 p.m., and even then the place was packed, which says it all. J.G. Melon is not just a burger spot, itâ€™s truly a New York institution and for a reason! The staff is super fast, constantly moving and monitoring their customers and gives off friendly vibes.
This burger easily ranks among the best Iâ€™ve had in the city (and trust me, Iâ€™ve had many!). I canâ€™t wait to go back and next time, I might add bacon, but todayâ€™s classic cheeseburger was perfection.
A flavor so iconic it stayed with me for hours afterwards and honestly I keep thinking about it!
So good. Love this place. Best burger Iâ€™ve had in a long time! Love the  crispy potato chips as well, nice change to normal fries. We were lucky enough to arrive before it got really busy.

J.G. Melon is one of my favorite spots in NYC â€” a place from another time. Warm, charming, and impeccably clean. We absolutely love the burger. The tables are great, but sitting at the bar is a unique experience on its own. A true New York institution. The entire staff is professional and friendly. An absolute must for anyone looking to enjoy an unforgettable, authentic New York experience

Is it worth you wait?
Yes, if you havenâ€™t experienced this iconic spot. Pass if youâ€™re expecting a delicious top tier burger ğŸ™ƒ

Wait time = 25mins to 1hr+

Food 3/5
ğŸ” Cheese burger was nice and charred in some areas but inconsistent inside. The biggest issue was the dryness overall
ğŸŸ A bit embarrassing that the fries were the highlight of the entire meal - uniquely cut into potato chips
Chili wasnâ€™t too bad, nice and chunky

Service 4/5
Decent NY attitude throughout the experience. No issues despite the amount of tables and foot traffic.

Ambience 3/5
definitely an old school vibe inside and out
The bathroom was tiny and pretty dirty imo

Donâ€™t be fooled by the line at JG Melon; the wait time is minimal, especially during the week. However, if you have a large party, it might be challenging to find a seat since the restaurant is relatively small but cozy. It offers an authentic NYC vibe, and the service is fast and quite good. When it comes to food, you have to try the burger and their cottage friesâ€”they're a must. The burger is juicy and well-seasoned, while the fries are perfectly crispy and not greasy. If you find yourself on the Upper East Side, this restaurant is a must-visit.

I donâ€™t get the hype honestly. Burger was good fries were good. I donâ€™t see why itâ€™s so popular. I got seated immediately and my waiter was good. If I had to wait thirty minutes or more like some folks are I wouldâ€™ve been very disappointed. If you walk by and see itâ€™s fairly empty go check it out. Definitely worth a visit but temper your expectations.

Itâ€™s almost like getting a bagel in New York â€” waiting in line is part of the ritual, building anticipation. The scent of sizzling patties and the sight of burgers constantly flying out of the kitchen send your brain into pre-meal overdrive.

We actually came here twice. The first time, we gave up â€” the wait was just too long. The second time, we got lucky and snagged a table after about 20 minutes. While waiting at the bar, I had time to take in the half-open kitchen and quirky dÃ©cor. At least twenty thick patties were cooking at once, filling the air with that irresistible, savory aroma.

The melon-themed interior is full of character â€” think melon art, melon clocks, melon paintings. It feels like youâ€™ve stepped into the eccentric collection room of a mischievous melon-obsessed boy. Itâ€™s weirdly charming and totally genuine.

Then thereâ€™s the burger â€” the undisputed star of the show. Itâ€™s minimalist: just meat, cheese, and bread. Pickles and onions are served on the side. No lettuce, no tomato, no fancy sauces â€” just pure, unadulterated confidence in the quality of their beef. And theyâ€™re right to be confident. The patty is perfectly cooked â€” juicy, with just the right balance of fat and meat, slightly crispy on the outside, and tender inside. The fries? Also excellent.

Despite how busy it was, the service stood out. No one rushed us to leave after we finished. In many popular spots, you can feel the pressure to free up your table â€” but not here.

When we stepped outside, a cheerful crowd was still waiting. Everyone was smiling for some reason. Eating at JG Melon feels like a little festival, and Iâ€™d definitely come back â€” just for the vibe.

The food and ambiance were both great. However, I can't help but question whether we experienced racial discrimination from our server. He told us the exact amount of tip he expected us to pay(20% of the total bill including tax) and ordered us to pay it.
I have no problem with tipping 20%. In fact, I was willing to pay it. But tipping is supposed to be the customer's choice, not something the server dictates. Still, we were prepared to pay what he asked, but we were short by exactly $1 in cash. When we handed him the money, he came back to demand the remaining $1, saying he â€œneeds to get all of his tip.â€
This was the first time Iâ€™ve experienced something like this while living in NYC, and it felt incredibly upsetting and awkward. Not wanting to be seen as a â€œdifficult customerâ€ over $1, I dug through my wallet and bag to come up with the last dollar.
As we were leaving, the server(an older man with glasses) deliberately ignored us. He didnâ€™t say goodbye or thank you, and instead turned his back and started taking a drink order at the bar while we were clearly walking out.
To that server: Do you tell all your customers exactly how much they must tip you? Do better. Please donâ€™t treat people this way.

The burger here is absolutely fantasticâ€”definitely lives up to the hype! However, as this is an incredibly popular spot, the overall experience feels a bit rushed. Thereâ€™s a noticeable pressure to order, eat, and leave as quickly as possible, which can detract from the enjoyment. Keep in mind itâ€™s a cash-only establishment, and they donâ€™t take reservations

OMG, worth the 45 minute wait which wasnâ€™t even a big deal as I went over to the bar down the street. The chili cup was incredible, it was a little chilly outside but it warmed me up with lots of flavor and happiness. The burger was one of the best Iâ€™ve ever had and the fries TOP.

Very nice authentic place to come for their signature burgersğŸ”¥ itâ€™s not a smashed burger, itâ€™s a real classic New York famous burgerğŸ˜ prices are very affordable, but they are CASH ONLY, so make sure you bring some cash.

The service was not that good. Even though the hostess was welcoming and sat our party of 2 within 10min since we walked in, the waitress was rude, we felt rushed and not taken good care of.

The atmosphere is very cool there, youâ€™d feel like you are in the 90th. Itâ€™s a real New York vibe! â¤ï¸

Important: This is a cash only place and there is not ATM inside. Thereâ€™s a Wells Fargo in the next block.

We went there on a Friday for lunch and the place was crowded. We waited in a line outside for around 45 to 60 min. The burgers were good, but not awesome as I personally expected. The service was ok, but it could be better. We saw people that got in line after us with the same # of people getting inside first. This kind of stuff also happened inside where people that sat later had their burgers before my table and the table that sat before ours. Our order also came missing bacon, but it was quickly solved after we report it.

We were lucky to have no queue but can see why it would be very busy, and it would be worth any amount of waiting!! Perhaps, the best burger I have ever eaten. Basic, but beyond amazing flavour. I would be a regular if I lived locally!
Almost every table ordered the cheeseburger and cottage fried so I followed suit and got it medium rare. It was really, really delicious. Cash only!!!

Food was so not special, donâ€™t be fooled by the line. Not worth it, way too overpriced also for a burger that literally looks better from macdonalds. Waited a very long time to get help and AFTER when we already left the restaurant one of the waiters had the audacity to follow us to ask for tip instead of adding it to the bill right away.

Extraordinary thick classic burger, amazing atmosphere.
Great service

Donâ€™t be fulled by the negative comments, itâ€™s truly a very good experience.

Iâ€™ll come back for more , no doubt.

Took about 45-60 min for us to be seated on a Friday night. Queue moves quickly. You can go inside to the bar and order a drink while you wait.

Burgers + cottage cheese fries are amazing.

Insanely mid. Egregiously overhyped. If the line is like an hour and youâ€™re here for the burger, trust me, you can do better.

It IS filling I will give it that but the bun is not toasted which makes it soggy, the patty could be better seasoned. Itâ€™s just mid. Palatable, filling but nothing worth the hype

Cute place with a bustling atmosphere. We were seated outside quickly, and the staff was very friendly. We hadn't noticed it was cash only, but they kindly directed us to an ATM across the street at Wells Fargo. Our food arrived quickly.

If you're craving a classic bar burger, this is the spot! My partner and I both had the Bacon Cheeseburger. While it didnâ€™t blow our socks off as some locals claimed, itâ€™s definitely solid bar food if thatâ€™s your thing.

Cash only! We read the reviews and prepared $100 cash before going. It was a lunch on a workday, so we only had 1 hour to go, eat, and get back. We arrived shortly after they opened for lunch. Not busy, but definitely more and more crowded as we were eating. Service was fast. Food was great. Many food shows had described their burger and chill bowl - all true. Only imperfection was the seats were tight, and there wasnâ€™t too much space between tables. But honestly most small diners/bars in the city have similar arrangements to fit more people.

JG Melon is the kind of place you go to when youâ€™re yearning for nostalgia and you always leave completely satisfied. The atmosphere is warm and cozy, the staff is attentive and kind, and the burger, fries, and chili are out of this world.

5/5 for sure. I have been on a short term secondment to NYC and in 6 weeks Iâ€™ve been to this restaurant three times. Iâ€™m a solo diner (and also a young woman) so I always found the prospect of dining solo at a bar (rightly or wrongly) really intimidating. The team make you feel like part of the furniture - enough to keep you comfortable but in no way overbearing. It is really relaxed and you do feel at ease. Onto the food- I had the burger twice and the steak once. Personally, Iâ€™d recommend the burger but I did enjoy the steak and also the salad (w blue cheese dip was delicious)! The staff here are all on their A-game and work really hard. Theyâ€™re really professional and care about doing a good job- itâ€™s very obvious. I can imagine it must be difficult to be doing these hours because itâ€™s a late night spot but busy all day! Special shout out to Patrick behind the bar who took great care of me and even gave me the key-lime pie on the house (itâ€™s a MUST! So delicious) I didnâ€™t catch the name of the host or the Irish lady but they were also both great. Canâ€™t wait to come back again! Thank you to the whole team! Long live JG Melon!

Always love stopping in at JG Melon! We went around 6pm and only had to wait 5 minutes for a table. The burgers are always a great treat, along with the cottage fries. Our waiter was super friendly too! Reminder that this place is cash only so go to the ATM before! Sadly no matchbooks left but that didnâ€™t stop us from having a great time!
Loved it. It felt like eating at my grandmas house. Simple plates, REALLY good food, great atmosphere.

Great place for burgers in the Upper East side! The place is small and there is almost always a queue outside, so I would recommend coming here a bit before 12 or in the slower hours to not have to queue for too long. Service is good, and the food is pretty great! Definitely worth stopping by! The cheeseburger is the go to, and also the omelettes are really well done. The fries could do some improving.

Classic New York burger spot cooking up one of the best in the city.

Started with the cottage potatoes which were good, but got a cup of the chili which was great. Tons of flavor and seasoning; definitely try it.

The burger was big and juice; the best part was the char on the bottom that brought out an extra level of flavor and texture.

Must stop on any NY food bucket list
Melt in your mouth burger. Their style of thick cut wedge potato chip fries were great as well

No longer as good as it used to be. Itâ€™s sad, we got our burgers super well done & dry despite we ordered them medium. The apple pie is lumpy layers of apple like cake with chunks of sugary crunch stuff instead of their usual gooeyâ€¦
